channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How U.S. policy failed Gaza. And, the latest info on the Minneapolis school shooting
item.description: Exclusive interviews with NPR reveal how U.S. policy during Biden's administration impacted Gaza. And, a shooter opened fire on a Minneapolis church yesterday, killing two children.
item.content:encoded:
Exclusive interviews with NPR reveal how U.S. policy during Biden's administration impacted Gaza. And, a shooter opened fire on a Minneapolis church yesterday, killing two children.

(Image credit: Bashar Taleb)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: North Korea's Kim will meet with Xi and Putin at Chinese military parade
item.description: With Russia's Vladimir Putin also coming for the parade, the event will underline the three-way alignment among Beijing, Moscow and Pyongyang in the face of a U.S. push to bolster its alliances with South Korea and Japan.
item.content:encoded:
With Russia's Vladimir Putin also coming for the parade, the event will underline the three-way alignment among Beijing, Moscow and Pyongyang in the face of a U.S. push to bolster its alliances with South Korea and Japan.

(Image credit: 朝鮮通信社/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Denmark summons U.S. envoy over claims of interference in Greenland
item.description: Denmark's foreign minister summoned the top U.S. diplomat in the country for talks after the main national broadcaster reported that at least three people with connections to President Donald Trump have been carrying out covert influence operations in Greenland.
item.content:encoded:
Denmark's foreign minister summoned the top U.S. diplomat in the country for talks after the main national broadcaster reported that at least three people with connections to President Donald Trump have been carrying out covert influence operations in Greenland.

(Image credit: Kwiyeon Ha)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The road to famine: How U.S. policy failed Palestinians in Gaza
item.description: As famine plagues Gaza, NPR exclusive reporting looks at the U.S.'s role in the humanitarian crisis. Many former officials NPR interviewed share a common refrain: Did we do enough to prevent this?
item.content:encoded:
As famine plagues Gaza, NPR exclusive reporting looks at the U.S.'s role in the humanitarian crisis. Many former officials NPR interviewed share a common refrain: Did we do enough to prevent this?

(Image credit: Khames Alrefi)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: 'AI slop' videos may be annoying, but they're racking up views — and ad money
item.description: Critics say that "slop" videos made with generative AI are often repetitive or useless. But they get millions of views — and platforms are grappling with what to do about them.
item.content:encoded:
Critics say that "slop" videos made with generative AI are often repetitive or useless. But they get millions of views — and platforms are grappling with what to do about them.

(Image credit: @funntastic_AI/Youtube)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Amtrak's flagship Acela trains get a long-awaited upgrade
item.description: The NextGen Acela trains, as Amtrak calls them, are faster and lighter than the current fleet. They're scheduled to start revenue service along the Northeast Corridor on Thursday.
item.content:encoded: The NextGen Acela trains, as Amtrak calls them, are faster and lighter than the current fleet. They're scheduled to start revenue service along the Northeast Corridor on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: What will the end of the 'de minimis' rule mean for U.S. consumers?
item.description: On Friday, the U.S. is ending its de minimis rule that made it easy for cheap goods to reach consumers. The change will affect roughly 4 million such packages processed each day.
item.content:encoded:
On Friday, the U.S. is ending its de minimis rule that made it easy for cheap goods to reach consumers. The change will affect roughly 4 million such packages processed each day.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: 70 years after Emmett Till's murder, Mississippi museum acquires gun used to kill him
item.description: It's been 70 years since Emmett Till, a Black teenager visiting relatives in Mississippi, was killed by white men because he whistled at a white woman. Now the gun used in his death is in a museum.
item.content:encoded:
It's been 70 years since Emmett Till, a Black teenager visiting relatives in Mississippi, was killed by white men because he whistled at a white woman. Now the gun used in his death is in a museum.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: Speaker Johnson slashed Medicaid. His constituents could lose health services
item.description: In Mike Johnson's district, not only could thousands of Louisianians lose coverage, health centers are bracing for a financial hit. They're hoping for additional funding to make up for Medicaid cuts.
item.content:encoded:
In Mike Johnson's district, not only could thousands of Louisianians lose coverage, health centers are bracing for a financial hit. They're hoping for additional funding to make up for Medicaid cuts.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Drew Hawkins

item.title: Minneapolis Catholic school shooting: What we know so far
item.description: Local authorities recovered additional firearms at three residences in the Minneapolis area that are linked to the shooter.
item.content:encoded:
Local authorities recovered additional firearms at three residences in the Minneapolis area that are linked to the shooter.

(Image credit: Abbie Parr)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
